metadata.Title: CVE-2017-5016 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Blink in Google Chrome prior to 56.0.2924.76 for Linux, Windows and Mac, and 56.0.2924.87 for Android, failed to prevent certain UI elements from being displayed by non-visible pages, which allowed a remote attacker to show certain UI elements on a page they don't control via a crafted HTML page.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5016` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 56.0.2924.76-0ubuntu0.16.04.1268
chromium-browser-l10n - 56.0.2924.76-0ubuntu0.16.04.1268
chromium-chromedriver - 56.0.2924.76-0ubuntu0.16.04.1268
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 56.0.2924.76-0ubuntu0.16.04.1268
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 56.0.2924.76-0ubuntu0.16.04.1268
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '56.0.2924.76-0ubuntu0.16.04.1268').
